name: Gambicoptero-V2
body:
# Introduction

Gambicoptero-V2 is a project intended to design and build a quadcopter with wireless distributed control, meeting the constraints of a hard real-time system.

It has being designed as a Final Project of the [Embedded Systems Laboratory](http://www.lisha.ufsc.br/teaching/esl/) course at [UFSC](http://ufsc.br/)

The name Gambicoptero is a joke combining the Portuguese words _gambiarra_ and _coptero_, respectively _workaround_ and _copter_.

Team: Bruce springteen, Cláudio, Crysthian guth, David Resner, Diego Izidoro, Tarcísio Eduardo Moreira Cromo

# Previous Work

In a previous term of this course a group made the first version of Gambicoptero. In homage to them we decided to call our own quadcopter Gambicoptero-V2(no relation to the german vengeance weapon).

[Video of Gambicoptero-V1 testing](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ExXRhufU8EQ)

Team: André Quintino Kuhnen, Tarcisio Fischer, Thiago Gelaim.

# Related Work

[WirelessHart](http://www.hartcomm.org/protocol/wihart/wireless_technology.html) is a protocol for real-time wireless control in mesh networks used in industrial automation.
